## HttpErrorHandlerStrategy.handle() method

Handles HttpError instances by logging and sending formatted responses.

**Signature:**

```typescript
handle(err: Error, res: Response): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

err


</td><td>

Error


</td><td>

The HttpError to handle


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

res


</td><td>

Response


</td><td>

Express response object


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

void

## Example


```typescript
// Example error flow:
throw new NotFoundError('User', { userId: '123' });

// This strategy will:
// 1. Log with 'info' level (based on error.logLevel)
// 2. Return 404 status code
// 3. Send client-safe error response
```
